Define the status of a tree based on the status of its stems.

Define the status of a tree based on the status of its stems.

add_status_tree(x)

Arguments

x

A ViewFullTable or a fgeo table.

Value

The input data set with lowercase names, and with the additional variable status_tree.

Examples

df <- tibble::tribble(
  ~PlotCensusNumber, ~Tag,  ~Status,
  1,    1,   "alive",
  1,    1,    "dead",
  1,    2,    "dead",
  1,    2,    "dead",

  2,    1,   "alive",
  2,    1,   "alive",
  2,    2,   "alive",
  2,    2,    "dead"
)
add_status_tree(df)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 4
#>   PlotCensusNumber   Tag Status status_tree
#>              <dbl> <dbl>  <chr>       <chr>
#> 1                1     1  alive       alive
#> 2                1     1   dead       alive
#> 3                1     2   dead        dead
#> 4                1     2   dead        dead
#> 5                2     1  alive       alive
#> 6                2     1  alive       alive
#> # ... with 2 more rows

Contents
